features: MDacne SOOTHING SHAVE CREAM: Shaving with sensitive skin prone to acne and folliculitis is hard. It can cause razor bumps, cuts, infections, and irritated skin. Our shaving cream was designed to help you get a soothing shaving experience without bumps or burns, no matter what type of razor you use. 1.7 oz
KEY INGREDIENTS: Originally made from the comfrey root and leaves, Allantoin is a natural anti-swelling antioxidant that helps soothe the skin and supports the healing of wounds, burns, and acne

TREATMENT BOOSTERS: Paeonia Albiflora Flower extract is a potent antioxidant that is known to moisturize and soothe skin. Palmitic acid helps slow the loss of water through the skin and is known to be non-irritating and suitable for sensitive skin
ALL-NATURAL & GOOD-FOR-YOU: MDacne Soothing Shave Cream is dermatologist designed and approved. Free from parabens and phthalates. Non-toxic, vegan, and cruelty-free

A DIFFERENT APPROACH: We founded MDacne to create a more effective and affordable way to treat acne. We’re on a mission to help clear your skin in an easier, faster, and more pleasant way than anything you’ve tried before

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works great for the African American bald head
reviews.reviewText: This is the best shaving cream to maintain my bald look. I’m African American man and have been looking for this type of shaving cream for the past 20 years. I’ve tried so many products but nothing has worked as well as this one. It’s so smooth and I don’t feel itchy at all. No bumps. Just a smooth shiny bald look once I’m done.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2023
reviews.reviewText: It works pretty amazing for me!!! Gets rid of a lot of red bumps for me! Not all but DEF A LOT!!! I wish they sold this in a larger tube!! I def recommend

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 31, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Good shave cream that does reduce irritation, but it doesn't last long
reviews.reviewText: Does this shave cream reduce irritation?Yes, especially redness, itchiness, and general discomfort after shaving. It also helps a bit with reducing bumps, especially along the neckline.Scent:I didn't detect a scent at all.Consistency:This is a medium thickness cream. This cream works best if you wet your hands, place some of it on one of your palms, then lather in your hands before placing it on your face or body.How long does it last?Unfortunately, based off the size provided, this cream doesn't last very long. I was able to shave my face 8 times per bottle.Would I use this cream again?No. I think it works well, but I prefer other creams (my preferred creams last much longer).3 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars No More Breakouts!!!!
reviews.reviewText: This stuff is so great! Shaving has been something I couldn’t stand doing because of the breakouts that would follow, which would lead to more acne scars and more anxiety, etc., but now I can shave as much as I want with no breakouts caused by skin irritation from shaving. I’ll never use anything else from now on!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: First and foremost, this "2 pack" is Madd up if two very petite tunes. Sure they are slightly bigger than a free shampoo at a 3 star motel, but not by much. This is wildly overpriced.Second, it isn't lubricating enough. Think shaving with maybe Noxzema. It simply isn't slippery enough.This stuff is going in the travel bag. It is acceptable for a trip because the tube is tiny and not pressurized but a daily shave product? Nah. This is travel and I'll suck it up for a week.First and last purchase. Buyer beware.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Works really well but can be a little messy
reviews.reviewText: I got this as I am prone to both irritation and redness after shaving. I recently started used shaving oil which has helped a bit but I was still getting little nicks here and there. When using this I was a little confused of the consistency and how much to use but was able to learn quickly how much to use. Now when shaving I usually shave twice a week with a nice little stubble since my hair grows back fast. I use a razor from Harry's which I find I like for the closeness of the shave. With this I take about a quarter size and add some water not too much and try and get it to lather the trick is not adding too much but not adding enough doesn't get it to apply as nicely. I will say in using this my razor glides over my skin nicely and I have no problems with the formula coming out of my razor say as if you were using a shaving cream. The only thing I don't care for is that since I shave out of the shower since I don't have a step to place my leg on I tend to get the stuff on my floor as I am shaving as I am transitioning to the sink to rinse it's not hard to get up and fairly noticable so you know where to get the stuff up it's just the additonal cleanup is all. Otherwise thou I have gotten a really nice irritation,redness, nicks free shave with this.
